 Text: I know this has been brought up before, but the Republicans are making it so that if you have a preexisting condition, your insurance will be cancelled and you'll pay more money out of pocket. This means that those who don't get coverage through their employer or government won't even be able to afford health insurance. It also makes it easier for employers not to provide healthcare coverage. If you're in an accident where you've had medical care before (ie car accident, heart attack, etc.) then you can still go back into work after having paid off all your bills because they can't just cancel your insurance, which would mean you'd lose everything. It's really bad news for anyone who's ever needed healthcare.

Science Title: The first ever image of a black hole 
 Text: [Here is the image](imgur.com/r3cvZq.jpg) taken by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope in 1995. It shows two jets shooting out from the center of our galaxy at speeds approaching 1 million miles per hour. These are known as jet streams and they can be seen on this image. They appear to originate near the galactic core where gravity pulls them apart. This picture was made using Hubble's Advanced Camera for Surveys.

Science Title: The first ever image of a black hole 
 Text: [Here is the image](imgur.com/kqnQcF) taken by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope in 1995. It shows an object that looks like it has been sucked into a black hole. This was discovered when astronomers noticed something strange about this object. They were able to see light coming from it, but they couldn't figure out what kind of thing had gotten inside it. So they took another look and saw that there are two holes on either side of the object, one at each end. These holes appear as bright spots because they're so far away from the center of the galaxy. Astronomers think these holes could be caused by some sort of gravitational interaction with other objects.

Science Title: The first ever image of a black hole in action. 
 Text: [Here is the image](imgur.com/zqj4rU) taken by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope on May 13, 2011. It shows an object that has been spiraling into and out of existence for about 13 billion years. This event was observed as it happened from our vantage point here on Earth. We can see how this spiral galaxy formed when its companion star collapsed under gravity to form a new star. As time goes on, more stars are born inside the galaxy, which eventually becomes so massive that it collapses back together again. Eventually, all matter within the galaxy's core will be consumed by the black hole, leaving just one small remnant at the center where light cannot escape. 
 
 I think it's pretty cool

 Text: [Here is the image](imgur.com/pqlHfZ.jpg) taken by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope in 1995. It shows an object that looks like it has been sucked into a black hole. This was discovered when astronomers noticed that they could see light from this object, which had not previously been seen with any other telescope.  I think it's pretty cool how we can use our telescopes to study things so far away.
